SEARCH
Module it.polimi.ingsw
Package it.polimi.ingsw.model.player

Class Player

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.events.Observable
it.polimi.ingsw.model.player.Player
public class Player extends Observable
Player object are used to handle a player's object within a game. A player is uniquely connected to a single game. A client can (virtually) be connected to multiple games, with multiple players, one for each game.

  • Method Details

    • loadPlayer

      public void loadPlayer(PlayerData playerData)
      Load Player's data inside the current player's object
      Parameters:
      playerData - PlayerData that contains data that needs to be loaded

    • getSaving

      public PlayerData getSaving()
      Retrieves the Player's data in a format that can be loaded by another Player object.
      Returns:
      PlayerData object containing the Player's data

    • getClientSaving

      public ClientPlayerData getClientSaving(String clientNickname)
      Retrieves the Player's data in a format that can be loaded by another Player in the Client's model. Requires a nickname in order to only put "secret" information if the data is going to be sent to the player that this object represents.
      Parameters:
      clientNickname - the nickname of the client that will receive the requested data
      Returns:
      ClientPlayerData object containing the Player's data that the receiving player is authorized to receive.

    • getColor

      public PlayerColor getColor()
      Retrieves the player's color
      Returns:
      PlayerColor object that represents the player's color, null if the player's color isn't selected

    • setColor

      public void setColor(PlayerColor color)
      Set the player's color
      Parameters:
      color - PlayerColor object representing the player's new color

    • setClientHandler

      public void setClientHandler(ClientHandler clientHandler)
      Allows to replace the player's ClientHandler with a new one.
      Parameters:
      clientHandler - the new player's ClientHandler.

    • getClientHandler

      public ClientHandler getClientHandler()
      Retrieves the player's ClientHandler
      Returns:
      the player's ClientHandler

    • setStartCard

      public void setStartCard(StartCard startCard)
      Sets player's starting cards. The player will get to choose which side to put place the card on.
      Parameters:
      startCard - the player's StartCard.

    • setPlayerCard

      public void setPlayerCard(PlayCard card, int index) throws InvalidParameterException
      Allows to add a card to the "hand" of the player.
      Parameters:
      card - the card you want to be placed
      index - the index you want the card to be placed (0invalid input: '<'=indexinvalid input: '<'=2)
      Throws:
      InvalidParameterException - throws InvalidParamException if the card is null, the index is too big or there already is a card at that index

    • setAvailableGoals

      public void setAvailableGoals(Goal[] availableGoals)
      Sets the player's available goals. The player is then required to select one among these as their definitive private goal.
      Parameters:
      availableGoals - an array of goals that represents the available goals for the player.

    • placeCard

      public void placeCard(Card card, boolean onBackSide, CardLocation location) throws InvalidParameterException
      Allows to place a card from on the player's board, the position the card was is then set to null,
      Parameters:
      card - card that needs to be placed
      onBackSide - true if the cards needs to be place with the back side up, false otherwise
      location - the CardLocation where the card needs to be placed
      Throws:
      InvalidParameterException - if there already is a card in the selected location or index is too big
      InvalidParameterException - if there already is a card in the selected location or index is too big

    • placeStartingCard

      public void placeStartingCard(boolean onBackside)
      Places the player's StartCard in the origin of the board. The orientation of the cards is also required
      Parameters:
      onBackside - true if the card should show the back side, false otherwise
      Throws:
      RuntimeException - if the players has no StartCard to place

    • getPrivateGoal

      public Goal getPrivateGoal()
      Retrieves the player's private goal
      Returns:
      the player's private goal

    • setPrivateGoal

      public void setPrivateGoal(Goal privateGoal)
      Sets the player's private goal
      Parameters:
      privateGoal - the new private goal

    • getPlacedCardSlot

      public CardSlot getPlacedCardSlot(CardLocation cardLocation)
      Retrieves the Card placed in a specified location

      The reference returned is a reference to the actual stored object. There's no problem since the card il placed, thus immutable (un-flippable).

      Parameters:
      cardLocation - CardLocation representing the location to get the card from
      Returns:
      a reference to the CardSlot in the desired location, null if there's no card

    • getBoard

      public Map<CardLocation,CardSlot> getBoard()
      Provides the Map representing the Player's board. The Map is returned using Collections.unmodifiableMap() that allows to safely expose the board without the need to clone and build it from scratch.

      This method should only be used when there's a necessity to compute a massive amount of queries (es. PatterGoal.evaluate) or if other kind of queries are needed; otherwise rely on the getPlacedCard() method

      Returns:
      an unmodifiable view of the board

    • getInventory

      public ItemCollection getInventory()
      Retrieves all the Items in the players inventory.

      An item is in the player's inventory if a card placed on the board has a corner containing such item on the face that's currently facing up and if the corner isn't covered by another card.

      A corner is covered if there's a card in the same direction as the Corner (es. for a top-left corner, you would need to check the top-left neighbouring card) and that cards was placed later in the game.

      Returns:
      ItemCollection with the number of visible corner in the player's board

    • addItems

      public void addItems(ItemCollection itemCollection)
      Adds a set of Items to the player's inventory
      Parameters:
      itemCollection - ItemCollection whose content needs to be added to the player's inventory

    • addItem

      public void addItem(Corner corner)
      Adds a single item to the player's inventory
      Parameters:
      corner - the item to add to the player's inventory

    • removeItems

      public void removeItems(ItemCollection itemCollection)
      Removes a set of Items from the player's inventory
      Parameters:
      itemCollection - ItemCollection whose content needs to be removed from the player's inventory

    • removeItem

      public void removeItem(Corner corner)
      Removes a single item from the player's inventory
      Parameters:
      corner - the item to remove from the player's inventory

    • hasDisconnected

      public boolean hasDisconnected()
      Checks whether a player has disconnected
      Returns:
      true if the player has disconnected, false otherwise

    • addPlayerCard

      public void addPlayerCard(PlayCard card) throws Exception
      Adds the specified card in the first available slots in the player's hand
      Parameters:
      card - the card that needs to be added to the player's hand.
      Throws:
      Exception - if the player's hand is full, so there's no room for a new card.

    • getAvailableGoals

      public Goal[] getAvailableGoals()
      Retrieves the player's available goals.
      Returns:
      an array of goals that represents the available goals for the player.

    • getStartCard

      public StartCard getStartCard()
      Retrieves the player's starting card.
      Returns:
      a StartCard object representing the player's starting card.

    • getPlayerCards

      public PlayCard[] getPlayerCards()
      Retrieves the cards in the player's hand.
      Returns:
      an array of PlayCards representing the content of the player's hand.

    • getPlayerCard

      public PlayCard getPlayerCard(int index)
      Retrieves the specified card from the player's hand.
      Returns:
      a PlayCard representing the player's card in the specified index.

    • hasLeft

      public boolean hasLeft()
      Checks whether a player has left the game or not
      Returns:
      true if the player has left the game, false otherwise

    • leftTheGame

      public void leftTheGame()
      Allows to set the player as offline (left the game)

    • rejoinTheGame

      public void rejoinTheGame()
      Allows to set the player as online (re joined the game)
